alert.note: Alert for Lenawee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 25 at 4:51PM EDT until June 25 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lenawee County in southeastern Michigan... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 450 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Pioneer, or 7 miles north of Montpelier, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Hudson around 510 PM EDT. Morenci and Clayton around 515 PM EDT. Adrian around 530 PM EDT. Blissfield around 540 PM EDT. Deerfield and Britton around 545 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Seneca, Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Macon, Lime Creek, Munson, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Ridgeway, Palmyra and Tipton. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan.
